User interactions.Log in or log on, sign in or sign up?: Use 'sign in' and 'sign up' for clarity and modern tone. Consistency reduces user confusion.
User interactions.Allow or enable?: 'Allow' relates to permissions; 'enable' activates features. Match wording to intent.
User interactions.Delete, cancel/discard or archive?: Clarify permanence and recovery. Use 'delete' for permanent removal, 'archive' for hidden retrievability, and 'discard' for form actions.
User interactions.Void or refund?: 'Void' stops unprocessed transactions. 'Refund' returns money after processing. Precision builds trust.
User interactions.Choose or select?: 'Choose' is conversational; 'select' is formal and UI‑specific. Align tone with product voice.
User interactions.Tap/Click, touch, press or hold?: Use platform‑specific terms. Maintain consistency for user clarity.
User interactions.Try again or retry?: 'Try again' is friendly; 'retry' is technical. Choose based on tone context.
